results.title: A Day at the dump
results.brief_description: A case history examining the folly of haphazard waste disposal. For 25 years, a quarter of a million tons of municipal refuse a year went up in smoke at a Washington dump. Depicts the conditions before funds for a comprehensive waste disposal program were made available. (The solution is presented in “Burn, bury or what?”)
results.description: A case history examining the folly of haphazard waste disposal. For 25 years, a quarter of a million tons of municipal refuse a year went up in smoke at a Washington dump. results.title: A Dangerous life
results.creator_credit: McElroy & McElroy, Hal McElroy and R. Markowitz
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the four day revolution in the Philippines. Told through the eyes of a television reporter and photojournalist, it backgrounds the struggle that led to the 1986 revolution which saw Aquino become president succeeding the ousted Ferdinand Marcos.
results.creator_credit_for_label: McElroy & McElroy, Hal McElroy and R. Markowitz

results.title: A Dancer's world
results.creator_credit: WQED, Nathan Kroll and Peter Glushanok
results.brief_description: Martha Graham, noted choreographer and modern dancer, discusses the dancer as a creative artist. She explains the dancer’s craft as members of her company illustrate her theories in a dance choreographed by Ms Graham especially for the film. Woven into the movements of the dance are all the basic techniques required by the modern dancer.

results.title: A Dancer's grammar
results.brief_description: Many films which pertain to dance and dancers tend to show only the seemingly effortless end product, while generally ignoring the hours of preparation that are involved. This film succinctly communicates the paradox of beauty achieved through sweat and diligence by focusing on the different preparations of two ballet dancers, Lois Bewley and Lawrence Rhodes. Photography by Peter Sova. No commentary - music only.

results.title: A Curriculum based on child development
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Elementary School Teacher Education”.
Projects undertaken by typical fourth-grade students are used in explaining the methods employed by an elementary school teacher to adapt the curriculum to the needs of her pupils. Points out that the developmental characteristics of pre-adolescents must be considered in all phases of the curriculum.

results.title: A Curiouse and diverse flora. Pt. 4: change and survival
results.creator_credit: CSIRO and Australian Academy of Science
results.brief_description: Shows how plants have adapted to the range of climatic conditions to be found in Australia, from the dry inland to the tropical rainforests. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: A Curious and diverse flora. Pt. 1: Botany Bay
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, Australian Academy of Science, Nicholas Alexander and Tony Chenn
results.brief_description: This film notes the profusion of previously unknown species of plants discovered by Joseph Banks at Botany Bay, such as banksias, the heath-like epacridaceae, the grass-like restionaceae, boronias, xanthorrhoeas, casuarinas and eucalypts. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
